title: Revolution Part 3 - Steal This Book Historical Analysis
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family (presenting Abbie Hoffman 1971)
overview: Historical documentation of Abbie Hoffman's 1971 counterculture survival guide 'Steal This Book' - a defining text of the Yippie movement that was so subversive many printers refused to print it

historical_context.author: Abbie Hoffman
historical_context.title_meaning: Meant to have people steal the book when they see it
historical_context.chicago_7: Hoffman was one of the Chicago 7 who incited riot at 1968 Democratic National Convention
historical_context.yippie_slogan: A Yippie is a Hippie that was beaten by the Cops
historical_context.legal_note: Book was considered so subversive that many refused to print it
historical_context.hoffman_background: Had been in MGM movies, had book deals

printing_workshop_section.thesis: Leaflets, posters, newsletters, pamphlets important to any revolution
printing_workshop_section.cost_estimate: Can begin with less than $100 and some space
printing_workshop_section.gestener_note: Silk Screen Duplicator turns out stuff almost as good as offset printing

underground_newspapers_section.importance: If your scene doesn't have a paper, you probably don't have a scene together
underground_newspapers_section.count_at_time: Over 500 regularly publishing with readerships from few hundred to 500,000+
underground_newspapers_section.ups: Underground Press Syndicate - $25 to join, helps with national ads, legal advice, directory

high_school_papers_section.critique: Usual high school paper run by puppet lackeys of administration
high_school_papers_section.purpose: To piss off the principal and radicalize the students
high_school_papers_section.court_victory: 1970 Connecticut ruling - students can publish without prior screening by officials
high_school_papers_section.aclu_resource: Academic Freedom in Secondary Schools pamphlet for 25 cents

gi_papers_section.challenge: Heavier scene than even high schools
gi_papers_section.method: Seek buddies, meet off base, contact civilian support (coffee house, anti-war org)
gi_papers_section.printing: Done off base, avoid government equipment
gi_papers_section.catch_22: No printed matter may be distributed on military base without CO permission (never granted)
gi_papers_section.advice: Use civilian volunteers in public roles

news_services_listed.lns: Liberation News Service - packets once a week, 30 pages, $15/month
news_services_listed.ups: Underground Press Syndicate - association of papers

switchboards_section.definition: Central telephone number anyone can call night or day for information
switchboards_section.telephone_tree: Pyramid system - core places 5 calls each, those call 5 each = 1000 people in under an hour
switchboards_section.san_francisco: Longest and most extensive Switchboard operation
switchboards_section.locations_listed: California, other Western states, Eastern states, other countries

guerrilla_broadcasting_section.legal_radio: FCC allows 100 milliwatt AM broadcast without license on free band space
guerrilla_broadcasting_section.range: 2-20 block radius depending on antenna height and building density
guerrilla_broadcasting_section.carrier_current: Plugging transmitter into wall socket, broadcasts on electrical wiring
guerrilla_broadcasting_section.if_caught: Warning first time, possible fine for repeaters
guerrilla_broadcasting_section.radio_amateurs_handbook: Recommended resource from American Radio Relay League

guerrilla_television_section.cable_tapping: Can be tapped at source or any point along cable
guerrilla_television_section.rf_signal: TV camera with RF output can send to receiver
guerrilla_television_section.video_tape: Sony CV series recorders becoming available
guerrilla_television_section.quote: One pirate picture on Amerika's living rooms is worth a thousand wasted words

demonstrations_section.definition: Different from other protest forms because it invites people via publicity
demonstrations_section.critical_element: Theater - education AND theater needed, not either/or
demonstrations_section.permit_negotiations: Can be used for added publicity
demonstrations_section.preparation: Map immediate vicinity, alternative actions, rendezvous point

protective_gear.clothing: Tight fitting, covers body surface, protection from gas and dragging
protective_gear.shoes: High sneakers for running or boots for kicking

helmets.steel_tank: $3, heavy but bulletproof with ear protection

other: Two numbers on arm (coordination center, lawyer)

trashing_section.definition: Not exactly rioting, not exactly guerilla warfare
trashing_section.guideline: Do as much property destruction as possible without getting caught or hurt
trashing_section.vehicle_targets: Only police vehicles and very expensive cars
trashing_section.principle: Every rock should make obvious political point - random violence produces random propaganda

people_chemistry_section.lace_joke: LSD + DMSO + water claimed to cause 'chromosome damage' - counterculture humor
people_chemistry_section.molotov_historical: Classic street weapon 'served up around the world'

first_aid_section.importance: As revolutionary struggle intensifies, injuries increase
first_aid_section.hospital_warning: Hospitals border on riot areas used by police to apprehend
first_aid_section.reporting_laws: Knife and gunshot wounds must be reported by law
first_aid_section.shock_symptoms: High pulse, cold/clammy/pale skin, trembling, unconsciousness
first_aid_section.head_injury_warning: Watch for sleepiness, headaches, vomiting, dizziness for 24 hours
first_aid_section.medical_committees: Medical Committees for Human Rights listed in multiple cities

legal_section.rule_one: Right to remain silent - give only name and address
legal_section.search_rights: Police cannot search without warrant or probable cause - do not consent
legal_section.at_station: Insist on calling lawyer, always have dimes hidden
legal_section.arraignment: Legal Aid lawyers free and often as good as private for arraignment
legal_section.national_lawyers_guild: Provides free legal services for political prisoners
legal_section.aclu: Will provide lawyers for civil liberty cases

draft_resistance_section.first_rule: No one shall serve in army of foreign power with which we have no alliance
draft_resistance_section.co_status: Sincere moral objections to war without necessarily belief in supreme being
draft_resistance_section.psychiatric_advice: Mental hospital stay can convince induction center shrink
draft_resistance_section.physical_exam_tips: Long hair helps - army doesn't want troublemakers

country_categories.safest: Countries with mutual offense treaties (Cuba, North Korea, Iron Curtain)
country_categories.next_safest: Unfriendly to US but risk of military coup (Algeria)
country_categories.sweden: Political asylum for draft dodgers and deserters, ~35,000 exiles
country_categories.canada: No political asylum but allows ~50,000 to live unmolested

exile_section.sweden_process: Go to police, state seeking asylum, fill form - stamp passport
exile_section.canada_process: Don't say deserter at border, qualify for landed immigration (point system)
exile_section.warning: Life in exile is not all a neat deal - most people unhappy

monkey_warfare_section.definition: Ideal for people uptight about guns - imaginative protest forms
monkey_warfare_section.safe_deposit_fish: Rent box with fake name, deposit fish, smell impossible to trace
monkey_warfare_section.mass_action: 10,000 people turning on all appliances at given time can cause blackout

underground_section.premise: Amerika is just another Latin dictatorship
underground_section.culture_defense: Our culture is our chief defense - FBI would stand out trying to infiltrate
underground_section.usual_capture: People caught for minor offense, fingerprints give them away
underground_section.10_most_wanted: Public relations gimmick - signal FBI conducting manhunt
underground_section.communication: Use pay phones, keep calls short, disguise voice
underground_section.final_advice: Dress warm in winter, cool in summer, stay high and keep on truckin

weapons_section_historical.training_advice: Contact National Rifle Association for gun club info
weapons_section_historical.gun_laws: Government Printing Office manual: Published Ordinances: Firearms

quiz_questions.q: What was 'Steal This Book' and who wrote it?
quiz_questions.a: 1971 counterculture survival guide by Abbie Hoffman - many printers refused to print it
quiz_questions.explanation: Defining text of Yippie movement, title meant to encourage shoplifting

quiz_questions.q: What was the Yippie slogan according to Hoffman?
quiz_questions.a: A Yippie is a Hippie that was beaten by the Cops
quiz_questions.explanation: Yippies were politicized hippies after police violence

quiz_questions.q: What did Hoffman say about education vs theater in demonstrations?
quiz_questions.a: Those who say demonstration should be education rather than theater don't understand either
quiz_questions.explanation: Both are necessary for successful demonstration

quiz_questions.q: What was the Underground Press Syndicate (UPS)?
quiz_questions.a: $25 to join, helped with national ads, legal advice, directory, news service

quiz_questions.q: What was Hoffman's warning about life in exile?
quiz_questions.a: Life in exile is not all a neat deal - most people unhappy, removed from struggle
quiz_questions.explanation: Many returned to join underground rather than stay in exile

historical_significance.chicago_7_trial: Hoffman and Rubin were defendants in famous political trial
historical_significance.legacy: Book became symbol of counterculture resistance

van_kush_connection.philosophy: Those who don't understand history are doomed to repeat its mistakes
